info.description: Production tracking shall be defined as the collection of activities that prepare the production response for Level 4. This includes summarizing and reporting information about personnel and equipment actually used to produce product, material consumed, material produced and other relevant production data such as costs and performance analysis results. Production tracking also provides information to detailed production scheduling and Level 4 scheduling activities so schedules can be updated on the basis of current conditions.
info.title: Tracking App Service ESB Contract

PerformanceTrackedMessage.description: The performance tracked and performance reconciled events provide the ability for Level 3 tracking activities to provide notification of operations performance and/or work performance to other Level 3 and Level 4 functions. In addition to operations performance and/or work performance, the information exchanged can also include the resultant material lot/sublot information that pertains to the performance of work that has been tracked.

PerformanceReconciledMessage.description: The performance tracked and performance reconciled events provide the ability for Level 3 tracking activities to provide notification of operations performance and/or work performance to other Level 3 and Level 4 functions. In addition to operations performance and/or work performance, the information exchanged can also include the resultant material lot/sublot information that pertains to the performance of work that has been tracked.

WorkPerformance.description: Work performance shall be defined as a collection of work responses that is a report on requested manufacturing requests. Work responses are responses from manufacturing that are associated with a work request. There may be one or more work responses for a single work request if the manufacturing facility needs to split the work request into smaller elements.

id.description: A unique identification of the work performance and could include version and revision identification. The ID shall be used in other parts of the model when the work performance needs to be identified.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the work performance.

workScheduleId.description: An identification of the associated work schedule, if applicable.  Work performance may not relate to a work schedule, it may be a report on all work for a specific time, or reported on by plant floor events.

startTime.description: The starting time of the associated work performance, if applicable.

endTime.description: The ending time of the associated work performance, if applicable.

publishedDate.description: The date and time on which the work performance was published or generated.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

WorkResponse.description: The responses from manufacturing that are associated with a work request shall be defined as work responses. There may be one or more work responses for a single work request if the manufacturing facility needs to split the work request into smaller elements of work.  A work response may include the status of the request, such as the percentage complete, a finished status, or an aborted status.

id.description: An identification within the associated work performance.  The ID shall be used in other parts of the model when the work response needs to be identified.

workRequestId.description: An identification of the associated work request, if applicable.  Work response may not relate to a work request, it may be a report on all work for a specific time, or reported on by plant floor events.

startTime.description: The starting time of this work response.

endTime.description: The ending time of this work response.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

JobResponse.description: The responses from manufacturing that are associated with a job order shall be defined as a job response. There may be one or more job responses for a single job order if the manufacturing facility needs to split the job order into smaller elements of work.  A job order may include the status of the request, such as the percentage complete, a finished status, or an aborted status.

id.description: An identification within the associated work response.  The ID shall be used in other parts of the model when the work response needs to be identified.

jobOrderId.description: An identification of the associated job order, if applicable.  Job responses may not relate to a job order, it may be a report on all work for a specific time, or reported on by plant floor events.

workDirectiveId.description: Identifies the associated work directive that was used, if applicable. This may not match the request, if alternate specifications are allowed.

workDirectiveVersion.description: Identifies the version of the associated work directive that was used, if applicable.

workMasterId.description: The version of the work master may be specificed in the attribute of this job response.

workflowSpecificationId.description: The workflow specification related to this job response.

workflowSpecificationNodeId.description: The workflow specification node related to this job response.

startTime.description: The starting time of this job response.

endTime.description: The ending time of this job response.

hierarchyScopeId.description: Identifies where the exchanged information fits within the role based equipment hierarchy.

EquipmentActual.description: An identification of an equipment capability used during a specified segment shall be identified as an equipment actual. Operations functions often require equipment as a resource to carry out tasks. Equipment actual shall include the identification of the equipment used, usually identifying a specific piece of equipment. Specific information about equipment actuals shall be listed in equipment actual properties.

equipmentClassId.description: Identifies the associated equipment class or set of equipment classes actually used for a specific segment response.

equipmentId.description: Identifies the associated equipment or set of equipment actually used for a specific segment response.  Typically either equipment class or equipment is specified, but not both.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the equipment actual.

equipmentUse.description: Defines the actual use of the equipment class or equipment.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of equipment resources used in parent segment, if applicable.  Applies to each member of the equipment and equipment class sets.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: Identifies the unit of measure of the quantity, if applicable.

hierarchyScopeId.description: The part of the supply chain that this equipment was used in.

id.description: An identification of the associated equipment property or equipment class property for a specific segment response.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the equipment actual property definition.
description.example: Dig Rate for a bucket load

value.description: The value or set of values for the associated property.  For example: Wet, Dry.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of equipment resources used in parent segment, if applicable.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: Identifies the unit of measure of the quantity, if applicable.

properties.description: The properties that this equipment actual property contains.

MaterialActual.description: An identification of a material that was used in the operations request shall be presented as a material actual. Material actual contain definitions of materials that may have be consumed, produced, replaced, sampled, or otherwise used in manufacturing.

materialClassId.description: Identifies the associated material class or set of material classes actually made for a specific segment response.

materialDefinitionId.description: Identifies the associated material definition or set of material definitions actually made for a specific segment response.

materialLotId.description: Identifies the associated material lot or set of material lots actually made for a specific segment response.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the material produced actual.

materialUse.description: Identifies the use of the material.  Defined values for production operations are: Consumable, Consumed, Produced. Defined values for maintenance operations are: Consumable, Replaced Asset, Replacement Asset Defined values for quality operations are: Consumable, Sample, Returned Sample Defined values for inventory operations are: Consumable, Carrier, Returned Carrier

storageLocationId.description: Identifies the actual location of the produced material, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of material produced by the parent segment.  Applies to each member of the material lot, materials definition, or material class sets.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: Identifies the unit of measure of the quantity, if applicable.

hierarchyScopeId.description: The part of the supply chain that this material was used in.

id.description: An identification of the associated material property or material class property for a specific segment response.

description.description: Contains additional information and descriptions of the material produced actual property definition.

value.description: The value or set of values for the associated property.  For example: Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

quantity.description: Specifies the amount of material produced by the parent segment.  Applies to each member of the material lot, materials definition, or material class sets.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: Identifies the unit of measure of the quantity, if applicable.

properties.description: The properties that this material actual property contains.

id.description: A unique identification of a specific material lot, within the scope of the information exchanged (production capability, production schedule, production performance, …) The ID shall be used in other parts of the model when the material lot needs to be identified, such as the production capability for this material lot, or a production response identifying the material lot used.

version.description: The version number of this instance of the Material Lot.

status.description: Status of the material lot. For example, released, approved, blocked, in process, in quality check.

description.description: Additional information about the material lot.

storageLocationId.description: An identification of the storage location or a physical location of the material lot.

quantity.description: The quantity of the material lot.

quantityUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated quantity, if applicable.

effectiveFrom.description: The timestamp that this state of the Material Lot is effective from.

effectiveTo.description: The timestamp that this state of the Material Lot expires.

id.description: An identification of a specific material class property.

description.description: Additional information about the material class property.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

properties.description: The properties that this material lot property contains.

id.description: A unique identification of a specific piece of equipment, within the scope of the information exchanged (manufacturing operations definition, scheduling, capability and performance) The equipment ID shall be used in other parts of the model when the equipment needs to be identified, such as the production capability for a piece of equipment, or a production response identifying the equipment used.

version.description: The version of this Equipment that this message describes.

equipmentLevel.description: An identification of the level in the role based equipment hierarchy.

equipmentClassId.description: The type of this Equipment item

hierarchyScopeId.description: The part of the supply chain where the Equipment item exists.

effectiveFrom.description: The timestamp that this Equipment item version is applicable from.

effectiveTo.description: The timestamp that this Equipment item version is applicable to.

id.description: An identification of the specific property.

description.description: Additional information about the equipment property.

value.description: The value, set of values, or range of the property. The value(s) is assumed to be within the range or set of defined values for the related equipment property.

valueUnitOfMeasure.description: The unit of measure of the associated property value, if applicable.

properties.description: The properties that this property contains.
